TopicTitle: Show off your awesome KSP pictures!

Articles.Content:
I think I'm making too many of these.

How do you make them rotate?

With inspiration from bac9 and Sapphire I now have a faster way of collecting kerbals who miss their reentry window.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
New version!

Orbiting the re-textured Mun in update 0.22!

I wish

The newly landed mobile base in standby mode. This lake will be the testing grounds of many vehicles in the future.

Mobility mode.

Here's some pics of my mission to circumnavigate Gilly!

Off I go, those treads actually work in this low gravity!

6 m/s uphill on Gilly?! I'm almost orbiting!

I seem to have run out of hill.

and now I'm stranded.

Here's some pics of my mission to circumnavigate Gilly!

Off I go, those treads actually work in this low gravity!

6 m/s uphill on Gilly?! I'm almost orbiting!

I seem to have run out of hill.

and now I'm stranded.

Stranded? You Kerbals can make orbit with only like 10% of their fuel right?
I finally landed on the VAB with a helicopter!

Unfortunately Donwell forgot to depressurize the cabin before going on EVA, resulting in him being quickly sucked out high above Minmus's surface.

Thankfully he made it down safely, only losing some of the air in his vehicle.

After decoupling the Moho Surface Element (MSE)

a Comsat launch

Mission [CLASSIFIED] has attained Laythe orbit. Finally, the mysteries of the Joolian system will be unveiled! Probe 1 has been ejected. Touchdown in 12 minutes and 26 seconds.

We totally meant to land in the middle of the ocean with only 1 solar panel. Of COURSE we did.

Well, here's what we have to show for it... Water. Water everywhere.
Looks! It's a Sherman (or on kerbin, an M4 Kerman)

Played around with KSP last night and decided to try an imitate some of the Project Gemini (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gemini_program) missions.

My Titan rocket with one mail sail engine; get's the Gemini spacecraft nicely into a 70K orbit, a tiny push from the engine is enough to de-orbit the Titan.

The rendezvous of Gemini 6 and 7, December 1965

Moar rendezvous of Gemini 6 and 7, December 1965

This is when I realized Jebediah was still stuck in orbit around Kerbin in my Hubble telescope.

So I launched my Titan rocket and Gemini Spacecraft to a 200K orbit to send a replacement for Jeb.

I did dock at some points of these missions, but I enjoy formation flying more. I had this slight problem with the clipping of the 1 man pod of the Hubble. My replacement kerbonaut just flew through it instead of boarding. Reloading the spacecraft solved it :-)

Is something wrong with your screenshot function? There seem to be more and more people posting actual photos of their monitors instead of posting the screens captured from in-game (f1).

Am I missing something here? Is this a "thing" now, or is it just this one (imaginative and prolific) player having an issue with it?

If the latter is the case, something I might be able to do to help?

Is something wrong with your screenshot function? There seem to be more and more people posting actual photos of their monitors instead of posting the screens captured from in-game (f1).

Am I missing something here? Is this a "thing" now, or is it just this one (imaginative and prolific) player having an issue with it?

If the latter is the case, something I might be able to do to help?

you know, looking at them it is a quick and easy way to get a lo-fi looking image, for some reason it looks like the grainy footage form the apollo missions

No nothing is wrong: I just wanted to show off what i did last night at and these are the only images I've got with me on my phone since i send them to a friend last night..

edit: signature does show up :-)

No nothing is wrong: I just wanted to show off what i did last night at and these are the only images I've got with me on my phone since i send them to a friend last night..

edit: signature does show up :-)

Here I was gonna one up you for the cool grainy effects

Here I was gonna one up you for the cool grainy effects

And then there's that. It worked quite well with my Springbok V mission to the Mun.
I now claim Laythe for myself.

No one can take a joke

Oh well. Nice job dude!

he isn't a nation

Yeah, that passage doesn't include people OR companies. Also, if you have jurisdiction and control over an object, doesn't that give basically the same effect as claiming national appropriation? You can basically make whatever laws on that object you want.

LOL, guys, I'm joking around!

Well, you guys seem to not be able to take a joke. I'll edit it now.

LOL, guys, I'm joking around!

Well, you guys seem to not be able to take a joke. I'll edit it now.

I thought it was an actual passage from International space law or something...

I thought it was an actual passage from International space law or something...
